text: our patients going into hospital at
weekends more likely to die within a
certain time than those admitted on
weekdays it's turned into a highly
controversial debate as the government
calls for better NHS services on
Saturdays and Sundays we are absolutely
determined to eliminate the weekend
effect which sees 11,000 excess deaths
every year it's become a key issue in
the junior doctors dispute ministers
argue that more staff are needed at
weekends to cut excess deaths the junior
doctors say they already work on
Saturdays and Sundays and challenge the
idea of a weekend effect now one medical
expert has questioned the data behind
the excess deaths estimate we certainly
found no evidence from you put together
all the high quality studies it really
is an excellent example of how poor
quality data badly interpreted can lead
to the wrong answer this study found
some of the data behind death rates was
wrong of 1700 reported hospitals stroke
admissions on weekdays more than 600
were actually for more routine problems
with a lower risk of death leading to a
false impression that weekday admissions
were safer but NHS Chiefs insisted that
this work did not invalidate earlier
research which pointed to excess deaths
amongst patients who went into hospital
at weekends the latest studies are very
small study the study last year was a
large study of 15 million patients and
showed a definite weekend effect in
terms of risk of mortality when you're
admitted to hospital as an emergency in
terms of what NHS England's policy is we
believe that we have to provide
consistently better care for patients at
weekends the Health Secretary was
challenged on all this at a
parliamentary hearing today I think that
you without getting into a sort of my
academic study versus your academic
study debate I think actually we can
agree that there is a weekend effect
this latest row of NHS weekend services
and death rates comes at a sensitive
time in the junior doctor dispute today
for the first time in three months the
British Medical Association and the
governor
and sat down for talks with a timetable
of just five days to try to resolve
their differences whatever the outcome
of the talks the debate over weekend
patient care and safety in English
